intro: Bryophyllum mortagei, commonly known as the "Ghost Plant," is a unique species of flowering plant belonging to the Crassulaceae family. It is a succulent plant characterized by its thick, fleshy leaves that store water, allowing it to thrive in arid environments. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, adding to its ornamental appeal. Bryophyllum mortagei is native to South Africa and is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its ability to propagate through leaf cuttings. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both horticultural and scientific study.
